days.title: STARS Recycling Program
days.description: S.T.A.R.S. or  "Students and Teachers Achieving Recycling Success", was created by Subaru of Indiana to plant the environmental stewardship seed throughout the local school districts, SIA encouraged high school students and teachers to organize recycling programs and implement other environmental initiatives. With Heritage Interactive Services and Oscar Winski as corporate partners, SIA provided guidance and funding to help schools develop and launch their environmental programs. To date, the STARS program has affected over 5,000 high school students in Indiana.
days.shortdesc: Subaru of Indiana creates groundbreaking local school program to spread environmental stewardship.

days.title: 2005 Reduce / Reuse / Recycle Report
days.description:
The 2005 SIA plant reuse, reduce, and recycle numbers are in:

 

Recycled

 

▪ Solvent soaked rags – 18,000 pounds recycled

▪ Light bulbs – 7,500 pounds recycled

▪ Cardboard – 3,471,400 pounds recycled

▪ Polystyrene and propylene – 337,000 pounds recycled

▪ Wood pallets – 378,000 pounds recycled

▪ Steel – 22.8 million pounds recycled

 

 

Reused

 

▪ Brass lug nuts – 33,000 pounds annually reused

▪ Solvent reuse – 35,597 gallons reused

▪ Water reuse – 16,832,197 gallons over 2 years reused

▪ Packaging material – 34 million pounds reused

 

 

Reduced

 

▪ Scrap steel reduction = 102 lbs/unit

▪ Lead free electrodeposition coating = annual 60,000 lb of toxic waste

▪ TRI emissions = 40% reduction
days.shortdesc: Subaru report detailing plant reuse and recycled numbers
